DOC.brief_title: Exercise Training Sequence Subacromial Impingement Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: While physical therapy effective element rehabilitation rotator cuff ( RC ) disease , effective sequence training intervention define . The purpose study determine difference pain function patient give RC strengthen prior initiate scapular stabilization exercise . The study prospective randomize crossover design . 26 men 14 woman , mean age 51 , diagnose subacromial impingement syndrome ( SAIS ) randomly assign one two group comprehensive standardized rehabilitation program six visit orthopedic outpatient clinic . One group prescribe 4-week program scapular stabilization exercise group begin RC strengthen exercise . The crossover design group add previously exclude four exercise second month rehabilitation .
DOC.criteria: 1880 year age diagnosis Neer Stage I/II subacromial impingement primary pain complaint shoulder and/or upper arm presence least two follow finding : painful arc , weakness external rotation , positive impingement sign ( HawkinsKennedy Neer/Walsh test ) , pain and/or weakness resistance internal rotation , external rotation , scapular plane elevation . concurrent medical comorbidities include pregnancy , diabetes , rheumatoid arthritis osteoarthritis great grade 2 KellgrenLawrence scale current diagnosis and/or previous history glenohumeral instability dislocation fullthickness rotator cuff tear adhesive capsulitis fracture scapula , clavicle humerus scapulothoracic rotator cuff paresis shoulder surgery past year inability speak English language level sufficient obtain informed consent .
